paper.title: An options pricing method based on the atmospheric environmental health index: an example from SO2
paper.abstract: Environmental finance has gradually become an important tool for solving atmospheric pollution problems. The creation of options based on an atmospheric environmental health index (AEHI) is designed to support a rational pricing of financial products related to the health of the atmospheric environment. To begin with, the improved Ornstein-Uhlenbeck model is established to predict the change in air pollutant concentrations, and then we construct the AEHI by using exposure-response Poisson regression model. In addition, an options pricing method for AEHI is proposed based on Esscher transform theory, and the universal investment strategy for enterprises is formulated to hedge operational risk by using the AEHI option. Finally, we use Beijing city of China, as a case study to demonstrate how to determine the AEHI options prices for two diseases in three age groups, and propose the investment strategy for an insurance enterprise. The AEHI options should therefore be used to compensate for the damage to human health caused by air pollution, and to hedge against the operational risks of related industries.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是基于大气环境健康指数（AEHI）的期权定价方法，这直接涉及衍生品定价领域。此外，论文还讨论了如何利用AEHI期权对冲运营风险，这属于金融风险管理的范畴。
